headline.main: Families Look at Failure on Health Care and Lament Politics

docs.lead_paragraph: In the ruins of President Clinton's promise of affordable cradle-to-grave health care, five families in Middle America have found their hopes for changing the health care system transformed into contempt for a Washington that they say, cares not a whit about them. "Why can't they just put their political parties aside and do something good for all of us?" said Debra O'Connor, 31, of Lisbon, Iowa, a factory worker and single parent with three young sons.
